conclusion: Analyze the position-time graph to determine vehicle's acceleration.
Vertical axis represents position (x/t) in m/s and horizontal axis represents time (t) in seconds.
Graph is a straight line starting at position 10 m when time t = 0 s.
Line extends backward (dashed) to intersect with the time axis at t = -2 s.
Straight line with positive slope indicates constant velocity and zero acceleration.
Y-axis labeled as 'x/t (m/s)' suggests graph might be showing velocity vs. time.
If vertical axis represents velocity, at t = 0 s, velocity is 10 m/s and increases linearly.
For velocity-time graph, slope represents acceleration.
Identify two points to calculate slope: Point 1 (0, 10) and Point 2 (-2, 0).
Calculate acceleration: (10 - 0) m/s ÷ (0 - (-2)) s = 10 m/s ÷ 2 s = 5 m/s².
The car's acceleration from the start of timing is 5 m/s².
